result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Exhibit #P1 Copy of Criminal Complaint

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:16 PM Defendant Jamie L Thomas appeared by video.  Attorney Dennis Michael Melowski appeared by video for Jamie L Thomas.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

3:18 p.m.   Exhibit #P1 is marked for ADA Cassidy.

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to appear via ZOOM and confirms that he can hear. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.
If at any time the defendant needs to speak privately with his attorney, the court will make accommodations for that.
Defendant indicates he understands the right to be present in the courtroom and has discussed with his attorney.
BY THE COURT: Court finds the defendant is knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily consenting to use of telephonic conferencing. 

3:19 p.m.  Deputy Sheriff A Printz is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Cassidy.
Atty Melowski will stipulate to the identity of the defendant.
BY THE COURT: 
Stipulation to identity accepted. 
3:27 p.m.  ADA Cassidy references exhibit #P1.
BAC .164
3:28 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Melowski.
3:43 p.m.  ADA Cassidy has no further questions.
ADA Cassidy offers exhibit #P1 into evidence.  No objection by Atty Melowski.  Received by the Court.
Witness is excused.
Atty Melowski has no witnesses.
Neither party gives a final argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
